intro: Galium kinuta f. roseum, commonly known as the pink-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often overlooked member of the understory flora.
